com.example.mdbook

Class Record

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.mdbook.Record

  • class Record
extends java.lang.Object
    The Record object holds the information about a record, usually held by a Problem.
    Version:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Noah Burghardt
    See Also:
    Problem, GeoLocation, BodyLocation, Photo

      Record(java.lang.String title, java.util.Date date, java.lang.String description)
      Generates a new Record object with given title, date and description.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Record

        public Record(java.lang.String title)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generates a new Record object with date and title. Description will be initialized as an empty string and date will be initialized as the current time and date. Photos will be an empty list, comment will be an empty string and all other attributes will be null.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of record, must be 30 characters or less.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if title length is invalid

      • Record

        public Record(java.lang.String title,
              java.util.Date date,
              java.lang.String description)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generates a new Record object with given title, date and description. Photos will be an empty list, comment will be an empty string and all other attributes will be null.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of record. Must be 30 characters or less
        date - Date associated with record, should be current date/time by default
        description - Description of record, including anything that might set it apart from previous records
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if title or description lengths are invalid

    • Method Detail

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(GeoLocation geoLocation)
        Add a geographic location to a record
        Parameters:
        geoLocation - geographic location to be associated with record

      • getLocation

        public GeoLocation getLocation()
        Returns geographic location of record
        Returns:
        The geographic location associated with the object. Returns null if record has no geolocation.

      • addPhoto

        public void addPhoto(Photo photo)
        Associate a photo with this record
        Parameters:
        photo - Photo to be added.

      • deletePhoto

        public boolean deletePhoto(Photo photo)
        Removes photo from record and deletes it from app storage.
        Parameters:
        photo - The photo to be deleted
        Returns:
        True on successful deletion, false if the photo could not be found.

      • getPhotos

        public java.util.ArrayList<Photo> getPhotos()
        Returns list of photos associated with the record.
        Returns:
        ArrayList\ of the records photos, including an ArrayList of zero items if there are no associated records.

      • setBodyLocation

        public void setBodyLocation(BodyLocation bodyLocation)
        Parameters:
        bodyLocation - The new body location.
        See Also:
        BodyLocation

      • getBodyLocation

        public BodyLocation getBodyLocation()
        Returns:
        Body location of the record, returns null if no body location has been set.
        See Also:
        BodyLocation

      • setComment

        public void setComment(java.lang.String comment)
        Sets record comment. Records can only have 1 comment.
        Parameters:
        comment - The new comment.

      • getComment

        public java.lang.String getComment()
        Returns:
        The comment for the record

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns:
        The title of the record. Should never be an empty string.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Parameters:
        title - The new title of the record.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if title is too short or too long

      • getDate

        public java.util.Date getDate()
        Returns:
        The date the record was recorded on.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns:
        The description of the record.

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(java.lang.String desc)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        desc - The new description of the record.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if description is too long (>300 chars)

      • setGeoLocation

        public void setGeoLocation(GeoLocation geoLocation)
        Parameters:
        geoLocation - new geographic location

      • getRecordID

        public int getRecordID()
        Returns:
        Record ID for this record. Will be null if record hasn't already existed in storage.

      • setRecordID

        public void setRecordID(int recordID)
        Parameters:
        recordID - Set recordID, should be generated from database.
